description: From Middle English beheden, bihefden, biheveden, from Old English behēafdian (“to behead”), equivalent to be- (“off, away”) +‎ head.

verbs.description: behead (third-person singular simple present beheads, present participle beheading, simple past and past participle beheaded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deliberately remove the head of; to cut off (someone's) head.
